learning_outcomes.description: Identify appropriate methods for statistical analyses from a descriptive scenario.
Demonstrate a foundational knowledge of statistical methods by carrying out simple statistical procedures by hand.
Use statistical software appropriately and confidently for exploratory data analysis and to make relevant statistical conclusions.
Effectively and appropriately communicate insights from data as evidence within an engineering context.

15/09/2025 - 19/09/2025

22/09/2025 - 26/09/2025

7/10/2025 - 10/10/2025

13/10/2025 - 17/10/2025

Individual questions are due by 4:00pm Fridays. Collaborative questions are due by the end of your allocated applied class.
assessments.task_description:
In each week (Weeks 8 - 13) there will be a quiz to complete online. Each quiz will involve 10 questions:

  • Five questions are individual questions. These questions will open at 8:00am on Monday and close at 4:00pm on Friday. Most will involve analysing data using Python and completing these will be an important opportunity to learn the details of using Python for data analysis. You are encouraged to discuss these questions using the Ed Discussion Board.
  • Five questions are collaborative questions. These questions will be completed during your allocated applied classes.

Your best five quiz marks will each count 3% each towards your overall grade (for a maximum of 15%).
assessments.submission_guidelines: Complete this assessment item through the link in Blackboard.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: You will receive a mark of 0 if this assessment is submitted late.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: Problem Set involving problem solving, analysis, visualisation and interpretation.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submit this assessment item through the link in Blackboard.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: The final examination in this course will be held during the end-of-semester examination period. The examination will cover all the material in the course. The exam paper will come with a formula sheet and statistical tables. You will need an approved calculator for use in the exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 7 To Week 13(08 Sep - 02 Nov)
learning_activities.topic:
Lectures

Each week we aim to cover one unit from the course notes. The units are (1) Visualise, summarise, and organise data, (2) Random variables and expectations, (3) Distribution of the sample mean, (4) Inference for a single mean, (5) Comparing two means, (6) Linear regression models.
learning_activities.topic_description: Lectures Each week we aim to cover one unit from the course notes. The units are (1) Visualise, summarise, and organise data, (2) Random variables and expectations, (3) Distribution of the sample mean, (4) Inference for a single mean, (5) Comparing two means, (6) Linear regression models.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 8 To Week 13(15 Sep - 02 Nov)
learning_activities.topic:
Applied Classes

There is one Applied Class per week for Weeks 8 - 13. During the Applied Class students will complete the collaborative component of that week's Online Quiz. The activities in the Applied Class may include collecting data, visualising and analysing data using Python, and communicating results.
